content:
Hello,

I'm sorry to hear that you're experiencing trouble opening attachments from one mailbox in Thunderbird. To troubleshoot this issue, you can try the following steps:

Update Thunderbird: Ensure that you have the latest version of Thunderbird installed on your PC. You can check for updates by going to the "Help" menu and selecting "About Thunderbird."

Clear cache and cookies: Clearing the cache and cookies of your Thunderbird application may help resolve any temporary issues. You can do this by going to the "Options" or "Preferences" menu, selecting "Privacy & Security," and then finding the options to clear cache and cookies.

Disable add-ons: Sometimes, add-ons or extensions in Thunderbird can cause conflicts or issues. Try disabling any add-ons you have installed and see if the problem persists.

Disable antivirus or firewall: Temporarily disable your antivirus or firewall software to check if they are interfering with the attachment opening process. If the issue resolves after disabling them, you may need to adjust the settings or exceptions in your security software.

Create a new profile: If the problem persists, you can try creating a new Thunderbird profile. This will start Thunderbird with a fresh profile, and you can add your email account again to see if the issue is resolved. Instructions for creating a new profile can be found on the Thunderbird support website.

If none of these steps resolve the issue, it might be helpful to provide more details such as the version of Thunderbird you are using, the type of email account, and any error messages you are receiving. This will help the Thunderbird support community provide more targeted assistance.

content:
All I can suggest it try the troubleshooting here https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems

If you have an antivirus program scanning in the Thunderbird profile folder, that is the first thing to stop. It made my system unusable on an SSD drive. I found that helped.

Rebuilding the global index has also been known to offer improvement for some folk. Other simply turn of the global search and indexer in settings

While I have no real basis for this I would assume that disabling the integration option to allow windows to search mail probably would help as it removes the need to write a second copy of each email to the local disk.

I turned off the option in the windows file manager for the profile folder and it's children to allow the windows indexer access to the files. At the time that also helped, but that was with a much earlier version of Thunderbird on a platter disk.

Perhaps I need to disable the global indexer. Each time I look in the activity manager (on the tools menu) it is determining what messages to index.

content:
The most common basis for messages appearing in Thunderbird as read, is they are already read, or downloaded, to another device like a phone or tablet.

How various servers report mail status is a configuration issue on the server so there are no hard and fast rules. But generally the mail has been accessed on another device. Or forwarded to another email address.

content:
If using an imap account then it is possible that it is not Thunderbird putting email into Spam. First we need to determine who is putting those emails into the Spam folder.

In the 'Spam' folder Make sure the 'Junk Status' column header is displaying. Are the junk flame icons a grey colour or a red/orange colour ? If they are grey then the server filter is putting the emails in the spam folder and thunderbird just displays it because it's a server folder - it shows what is on server. You would need to set up those emails as not spam via webmail account.

If the flame icons are coloured red/orange then it is Thunderbird marking as junk and putting emails into the designated Spam folder which in turn updates the server.

Please report back on what you see? Grey or coloured flame icon. Post image showing the Account Settings > 'Junk Settings' for the account. Disable this filter so it does not interfere whils testing - Set filters that move the mail back to the normal inbox either before or after the check.

content:
re :None of the fixes on the internet have helped.

Unfortunately that does not tell me anything. I do not know what fixes you attempted. So let's start at the beginning.

Please post the following information so we can check you are using all the correct server settings etc.

  • Help > More TRoubleshooting Information
  • Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' section
  • Post an image showing all the data in that section.

What comes after the @ in your email address? the domain bit.

What OS are you using ? Windows 10, MAC, Linux ? What version of Thunderbird are you using ?

Check this: In Account Settings > Server Settings for the imap account Is 'User Name' your full email address ? If no please edit and type full email address. Also check your outgoing SMTP server settings - User name = full email address. If you had to alter the user name: Exit Thunderbird, wait a few moments. Start Thunderbird.

When you are prompted to enter password, enter password and select the checkbox 'Remember Password' before you click on OK.


re :When I start thunderbird, I am prompted to enter password Is that normal ? Have you always entered the password each time ? Did you originally set up Thunderbird to remember the password, so it auto connects to server? Are any passwords actually stored in Thunderbird ? Check - what do you see?

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Under 'Passwords' section
  • Click on 'Saved PAsswords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'

Do you see any lines for the mail account ? Do you see lines for incoming and outgoing and if yes are the stored passwords correct? If passwords wrong - right click on each line for the account and select 'Edit Password' Completely clear all contents and carefully type in correct password. Is the 'user name' correct? it should be full email address.

If passwords are supposed to be saved, but there is no mention of the account: Do you use any product like CCLeaner, WiseCleaner or even some Anti-Virus products offer a file clean up - if yes...please do not let these products access to your thunderbird profile folders (make thunderbird exempt) as they have a habit of removing much required files.

Did you create the account as an IMAP account? You should not try to swap the server settings of a pop account to use imap server settings.


Note - I did find this: After logon to webmail to verify password is ok..... https://centurylinkwebmail.s.center/hc/en-us/articles/10789862037267-My-email-program-will-not-connect If you receive a server error or a password error in your mail client after you have verified through www.centurylink.net that your password is correct this is due to high traffic on our servers. While we have seen and will continue to see improvements, we expect a complete resolution within 72 hours.
creator: Toad-Hall

The IMAP settings for Thunderbird incoming mail is MAIL.centurylink.net.

Why ae the two different?

I have tried changing the settings to webmail.centurylink.net and get the same password incorrect message.

My mail is at mail.centurylink.net">webmail.centurylink.net, why are the IMAP settings mail.centurylink.net?

Name Connection security Authentication method Name Connection security Authentication method Default?

creator: maroroy

content:
maroroy said
Always set up to auto connect. When I login to mail at Centurylink homepage, I am connected to WEBMAIL.centurylink.net and I am able to access my mail. The IMAP settings for Thunderbird incoming mail is MAIL.centurylink.net. Why ae the two different?

The first one is a web page. Just as google.com is a web page. Any association to mail is incidental. Unfortunately webmail is not email and beyond confirming you know the user name and password really does not offer much. Even that assumes the same user name and password and that is not always the same.

When I get the incorrect password message it shows trying to logon to mail.centurylink.net.

I have seen a number of folk with issues on centrylink here recently, so I would guess the provider has changed some or all of the connection settings.

I looked at the web page at centrylink. https://www.centurylink.com/home/help/internet/email/how-to-set-up-your-email-server-settings-to-go-through-pop-and-smtp.html

That page talks about recent century link changes and goes on under a heading of "why can't I connect to my email?" https://www.centurylink.com/home/help/internet/email/migration-help.html#settings

Following the transition to our new platform, you may need to reenter your email username and password and make sure you have the correct server settings in order to reconnect to your mail app. See the section below for instructions on updating server settings for different operating systems. If you are having issues connecting, please chat with CenturyLink Email Support M-F 9 am-6 pm CST. Should you need support outside of these hours, follow the instructions in the chat to submit a help request form.

So I suggest you delete any saved passwords in the password manager for the account. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/password-manager-remember-delete-change-tb and ensure Thunderbird is using the correct user name in your account settings. (from the Android settings they provide it looks like that should be the full email address.)

The other settings you posted appear to be inline with their web page, except your outgoing setting which is set to STARTTLS and they recommend simply TLS. (they are not the same thing, but if you can send mail it is not important and STARTTLS is probably more secure, however if you suddently can't send mail then changing it to the recommended TLS would be the first move.)

Incoming Server (choose POP or IMAP) POP: pop.centurylink.net, Port: 995, Security: SSL IMAP: mail.centurylink.net, Port: 993, Security: SSL

Outgoing Server SMTP: smtp.centurylink.net, Port: 587, Security: TLS if available
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
re :Have two email accounts, cannot get bugs out. I've checked to see if you posted anything about these 'bugs' or problems you are experiencing, but your profile is only saying you have asked just this particular question.

If you explain what the problem is perhaps it can be easily fixed.

re: help with remove all TB. If you really want to remove everything and start completely afresh.... There will be the Thunderbird program itself and there will be all your profiles which contain mail accounts etc. For obvious reasons the profiles are not stored in the same place as the program.

If you have installed everything in the default location then it will be here: Thunderbird program will be in one of these locations

  • C://Program Files/Mozilla Thunderbird
  • C://Program Files (x86)/Mozilla Thunderbird
  • Delete the 'Mozilla Thunderbird' folder.

The Profile data will be in this location:

  • C://Users/User name/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird
  • Delete the 'Thunderbird' folder

Also check this location because Windows OS also keeps a cache record.

  • C://Users/User name/Appdata/Local/Thunderbird
  • Delete the 'Thunderbird' folder

Empty the computer 'Recycle Bin'

Download and install Thunderbird.

Advisory note: After installation of Thunderbird, please access the Firewall and make sure thunderbird is set up as an allowed program otherwise you can get potential issues with Firewall blocking access to the internet.

content:
Select 'Calendar' if not already in view.

If using top Menu Bar toolbar:

  • 'Events and Tasks' > select 'Find Events'

OR

  • click on 'Menu app icon' > 'Events and Tasks' > select 'Find Events'

This will display Events in table/spreadsheet format using columns above the Calendar. Far left - above the columns - use the drop down options to select the parameters of the view. You will also see a search box next to it. Example: 'Events in the next 7 days' contain 'Formula 1' This further filters the list of events that match. You can enable various columns in the usual way eg: enable the 'Category' column header. You can also search using a category. Example: 'Events in the next 7 days' contain 'Follow up' Or search for specific word in Event Description Example: 'Events in the next 7 days' contain 'Hospital'

content:
Hola Si la cuenta era IMAP los correos están en el servidor de correo a menos que hayas configurado una copia de los correos enviados a una carpeta local o hayas configurado las carpetas como "sin conexión" (Ajustes->Sincronización y almacenamiento->Seleccionar "En este computadora guardar los mensajes...") si no tenias ninguna de las opciones anteriores lo que se guarda son solo los encabezados de los correos. De todas formas los correos un deberían esta en el servidor de correo (a menos que tengas la opcion de eliminar los correos antiguos), suponiendo que tenias todo en carpetas locales o "sin conexion" entonces podrías instalar el Thundebird en otro usuario del S.O. (o en otra PC) restaurar la copia del perfil del Thunderbird anterior (imap) y utilizar el complemento ImportExportTools: https://addons.thunderbird.net/es/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/?src=search para exportar los correos.

Saludos

content:
re :you should be able to just look at the icon on the taskbar and see if there's anything new. Settings > General

There are options for different icons. for 'Task bar icon' - click on 'App icon options' Select 'Show badge icon' - if this is not selected then it will not display the options you selected. Select 'Count of new messages' to only how new messages since you last selected folders. OR Select 'Count of unread messages' to show any unread which may also include new since you last accessed folders. click on OK

Then there is the 'Alert' option. This displays in the the System Tray area - another name given to the Notification Area and usually displayed on far right of Task Bar. You can use the pop up Thunderbird alert system OR the select the Windows Notification system.

  • Select 'Show an alert'
  • Click on 'Customise'
  • Select what you want to see.
  • Message Preview Text
  • Subject
  • Sender
  • Set how long the new mail alert should display
  • click on OK

Then you also have the option to display a thunderbird icon in the Tray area which displays number of new mail, but it is rather small, it's designed to let you know if new mail has arrived.

There is also the sound option which works best if you are using the computer audio as opposed to the headset. It means you can increase the volumn and will hear it from other areas of the house. I've set mine up to use a sound - it's just 'Mail Call' as used in MASH.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :but I also have not been able to figure out how to add addresses to my address book from the address bar in new emails.

In received email header eg: FROM name email address shows a pale head icon

  • Click on the name email address - pop up appears - select 'Add to Address Book'
  • Auto added to Personal Address Book and icon turns blue to denote this.

To alter the destination Address Book or add more data

  • Click on email address again and select 'Edit Contact'
  • If you just want to move to a different address book, then choose the address book and click on ok

I find it easier to then select 'Edit Details' as this directly opens on the Edit contact in the Personal Address Book. Then I can enter name and display name if required plus any other necessary info. then click on Save. At this point, if desired, I can then add them to any Personal Address Book Mailing List.

Another example but this time you are creating a new Write message to send and you enter a TO email address. You can set it up to auto add that TO email address to whatever address book you prefer. I think the default is the 'Collected Addresses ' address book.

  • Settings > Composition
  • Scroll to 'Addressing' section
  • Select checkbox 'Automatically add outgoing email addresses to my' - choose prefered address book.

content:
I have just updated from Windows 10 to 11, so can not really replicate your issue, and I certainly never observed it in the years I used Windows 10, despite fiddling with the settings fairly regularly to respond to support requests. My preference is to not be annoyed by noise and notifications when I get mail.

However, there are some things to consider.

In addition to the information Toad-hall provides, you can also click on the little "person" widget beside the name in the message header.

In that image from an email to me from this forum, you will see the "person" is a different colour in the two entries. The black one when clicked will simply add the address to the address book using the default personal address book. The second (in my case blue) signifies the address is in my address book, and allows the editing of the already present entry in the address book, first in a small pop up offering the Name and address book associated with the address and on clicking the edit button in the popup everything in the address book record.

When I send myself an email I get a popup, after I enable the settings. I also played a huge long Apollo lift off wave file from a support matter about 5 years ago.

So I would have to say the feature to notify works.

Then there are the badges, which show number on the taskbar icons. Are they enabled in your copy of Windows. Certainly they are enabled by default in Windows 11, but not so with Windows 10.

These folk offer instructions on enabling the badges on Windows 10 and where the first result when I googled for the instructions. https://www.isunshare.com/windows-10/how-to-show-or-hide-app-badge-on-windows-10-taskbar.html

Finally have you tried enabling the setting "when Thunderbird is minimized, move it to the tray" I have a feeling you are closing it, not minimizing it and enabling that setting would fix the issue without going to more detail.

creator: lyttle.joan

content:
It seems you have a gmail account and I'm assuming it is set up as IMAP.

Background info so you understand what's going on.

Gmail stores all of it's emails in the 'All Mail' folder. Gmail realise that this is not exactly very userfriendly, so they created 'labels' which means they offer a view which looks like folders. When a 'label' is applied to the email in the 'All Mail' folder, it gets displayed in whatever the label is called. When a new email arrives on the gmail server, it will auto get the 'Inbox' label. Depending upon whatever settings you have set up in the webmail account, it may also get another label eg: 'Important'. The application of 'labels' means the one sinle email in the 'All Mail' folder can be seen in more than one label/folder. They are not separate copies of that email, just a virtual view of email in various folders/labels. When you delete an email you need the email to go to the gmail Trash folder/label which is sometimes also called 'Bin'. Gmail will then realise you want to delete the email from the 'All Mail' folder, so all labels get removed and email cannot be seen in any folder and after 30 days gmail will auto remove that deleted email from the 'Trash' and it's gone.

In Thunderbird, you need to use an imap account in order to see all the same 'labels/folders' as shown on the server. In Thunderbird those gmail 'labels' are separate files, they are displayed as folders. All default server folders will be auto subscribed to be seen.

You must set up Thunderbird to do the following. When you delete email - put email in the gmail default 'Trash' folder. Check this now and confirm you have this set up properly.

  • In Account Settings
  • Select 'Server Settings' for the gmail account
  • When I delete a message:
  • Select : 'Move it to this folder' and select 'Trash on gmail account/email address'

If you make any changes to this setting please check to see if deleting now works ok. Post an image showing this setting so we can see what you are using.

Then when you click on 'Delete' email should get put into the gmail 'Trash' folder.

However, there may be occasions when you want to delete the email from one folder but not all folders eg: delete from Inbox but keep the same one displayed in 'Important'. OR delete the email from the imap account Inbox but keep it stored on server in 'All Mail'. This process means you really need to instruct gmail to just remove a 'label' not actually delete completely. In Thunderbird, you need to use a different delete method, one that bypasses the gmail Trash. Using keyboard - Hold down 'Shift' and click on the 'Del' key. Note there is no 'Undo' action available for this. But it does mean email is still in 'All Mail' folder, so you could access gmail webmail account and get a label re-applied for whatever folder you want.

You say when you delete an email, it reappears in four different places. There are two things here to clarify: 1. What method are you using to delete ? Are you right clicking on email and selecting delete message ? Are you reading email in Message Pane and clicking on 'Delete' button ? Do you have the 'Delete' column header enabled - select email and click on the bin icon in column ? There are other methods - what method are you using?

'2. 'What four different places are you talking about? If you see the 'All Mail' folder in folder Pane then I'll advise you to unsubscribe from seeing it because it is just a complete copy of absolutely everything you are already seeing in all other folders. In Folder Pane

  • right click on the gmail account name and select 'Subscribe'
  • Select the 'All Mail' folder and click on 'Unsubscribe'
  • Click on 'OK'

Please tell us what other places the deleted email appears.

Suggest you post an image of the Folder Pane so we can see all the list of folders.
